question.short: Is GMO consumption harmful to health?
question.long: Does the consumption of Genetically Modified Organisms have negative effects on human health?

description: Results from studies evaluating the impact of Genetically Modified Organisms (GMOs) consumption on human health outcomes.

no_consensus.description: The literature has not yet reached a consensus on the effects of GMO consumption on health

no.description: The literature suggests that GMO consumption is not harmful to health

towards_no.description: The literature suggests that GMO consumption is probably not harmful to health, but more research is needed

towards_yes.description: The literature suggests that GMO consumption is likely harmful to health, but more research is needed

yes.description: The literature suggests that GMO consumption is harmful to health

no.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of the GMOs evaluated on health

no_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper show no significant effect of the GMOs evaluated on health, unlike what is reported in the literature

no_but_mixed_results.description: The results of the paper show no significant overall effect of the GMOs evaluated on health, but there are mixed results on specific cases

maybe.description: The results of the paper suggest that the GMOs evaluated might have an effect on health, but the evidence is not strong enough to conclude

yes_but_low_confidence.description: The results of the paper suggest that the GMOs evaluated may be harmful to health, but the evidence is not strong

yes_but_small_effect.description: The results of the paper suggest that the GMOs evaluated may have a small effect on health

yes_unlike_literature.description: The results of the paper suggest that the GMOs evaluated may be harmful to health, unlike what is reported in the literature

yes.description: The results of the paper suggest that the GMOs evaluated are harmful to health

papers.title: Results of a 13 week safety assurance study with rats fed grain from glyphosate tolerant corn
papers.quote: the comparable response of rats fed diets containing Roundup Ready corn grain to rats fed diets containing control or reference control corn grain provides significant evidence of the comparability of Roundup Ready corn to its traditional counterparts

papers.title: A literature review on the safety assessment of genetically modified plants
papers.quote: An equilibrium in the number research groups suggesting, on the basis of their studies, that a number of varieties of GM products (mainly maize and soybeans) are as safe and nutritious as the respective conventional non-GM plant, and those raising still serious concerns, was currently observed

papers.title: Assessment of the health impact of GM plant diets in long-term and multigenerational animal feeding trials: A literature review
papers.quote: Results from all the 24 studies do not suggest any health hazards and, in general, there were no statistically significant differences within parameters observed

papers.title: RETRACTED: Long term toxicity of a Roundup herbicide and a Roundup-tolerant genetically modified maize
papers.quote: disruption of biosynthetic pathways that may result from overexpression of the EPSPS transgene in the GM NK603 maize can give rise to [...] pathologies that may be linked to abnormal or unbalanced phenolic acids metabolites, or related compounds

notes.title: Undisclosed conflict of interest
notes.description: The study was funded by large retailers and politicians

notes.title: No dose-response relationship
notes.description: Increasing the dose of GM maize in the rats' diet did not increase the observed effects

notes.title: Controversial institute
notes.description: CRIIGEN is known for its anti-GMO activism and previous controversial studies

notes.title: No statistical analysis
notes.description: The lack of statistical analysis, combined with the low sample size and the known high incidence of tumors in the Sprague‚ÄìDawley rat, makes these results unconclusive

papers.title: An overview of the last 10 years of genetically engineered crop safety research
papers.quote: The scientific research conducted so far has not detected any significant hazards directly connected with the use of GE crops. [...] there is no scientific evidence of toxic or allergenic effects

papers.title: Prevalence and impacts of genetically engineered feedstuffs on livestock populations1
papers.quote: These field data sets representing billions of observations did not reveal unfavorable or unexpected trends in livestock health and productivity. [...] field observations of animals fed diets containing GE crop products have revealed no unexpected perturbations or disturbing trends in animal performance or health indicators

papers.title: Genetically Engineered Crops

institution.name: National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine

papers.quote: GE food reveals no differences that would implicate a higher risk to human health from eating GE foods than from eating their non-GE counterparts. [...] The committee could not find persuasive evidence of adverse health effects directly attributable to consumption of GE foods

papers.title: Published GMO studies find no evidence of harm when corrected for multiple comparisons
papers.quote: We performed a statistical reanalysis and review of experimental data presented in some of these studies and found that quite often in contradiction with the authors‚Äô conclusions the data actually provides weak evidence of harm that cannot be differentiated from chance
